intro: Pachyptera dasyantha, commonly known as the woolly flatworm or woolly greenhood, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its unique, often hairy foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in a spike-like inflorescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rainforests or under dense canopy cover. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
